notes:
Because we are attacking with shurikens constantly, [Cybernetic Speed](item_6e88739f-7e7e-4e01-ba55-2e3c62c949ec) makes the most sense in Round 1 as it will basically constantly proc. The attack speed will also be handy in the early rounds because Genji won't be able to fish for kills as easily; instead, his goal is to farm damage for money. 

The most obvious poke-friendly items to build here are [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0), [Plasma Converter](item_25869f9a-9a29-4e19-96b6-9d8a28c59318), and [Ammo Reserves](item_982d53aa-5ef4-493f-93e7-9e374d0ebf34).

Replace [Ammo Reserves](item_982d53aa-5ef4-493f-93e7-9e374d0ebf34) with [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054). In addition, buy [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a). [Stockpile](item_a113eb56-9999-4f22-9bd7-18f4dbd00cc2) is a decent alternative, but attack speed is more valuable at this stage than ammo count because of the increased ability to deal pressure. [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054) also happens to be slightly cheaper. [Technoleech](item_cb7fd8bf-bdcc-439a-ad35-372f24a027a8) is a decent budget-friendly alternative to [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a).

[Sacred Shuriken](item_b32b34a9-0163-4092-875e-3a9817b7df54) is an obvious buy here as you can now poke with five shuriken at a time instead of three. Hopefully, you've done well enough in this round to afford [Weapon Jammer](item_72386db6-753e-413d-aa2a-f1389842f47f); you can sell [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) to help afford it.

If you've done especially well, you can spring for [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b) instead. If you buy this item, be sure to use normal Genji combos with Swift Strike to secure kills, since you do extra damage to low-health targets. Don't sell [Plasma Converter](item_25869f9a-9a29-4e19-96b6-9d8a28c59318) until you can afford to replace it with [Technoleech](item_cb7fd8bf-bdcc-439a-ad35-372f24a027a8).

Between [Weapon Jammer](item_72386db6-753e-413d-aa2a-f1389842f47f) and [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b), buy whichever item you didn't buy in Round 3 (most of the time, that will be [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b)). Also, replace [Plasma Converter](item_25869f9a-9a29-4e19-96b6-9d8a28c59318) with [Technoleech](item_cb7fd8bf-bdcc-439a-ad35-372f24a027a8) if you can afford to do so (ideally, you can).

If you can't afford [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b), then [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48) is a decent alternative. If you can't afford even *that*, you can get [Stockpile](item_a113eb56-9999-4f22-9bd7-18f4dbd00cc2), but that's a worst-case scenario.

In Round 5, we can start incorporating Dragonblade more aggressively into our poking with [Dragon's Breath](item_32dc8374-7541-46fb-9891-29b7fbe9ed4d). From here on out, building AP or buying Dragonblade-specific items is a decent investment if we decide being a Dragonblade bot is important.

If we don't have enough money to buy our proper third Epic, then it's time to sell either [Technoleech](item_cb7fd8bf-bdcc-439a-ad35-372f24a027a8) or [Plasma Converter](item_25869f9a-9a29-4e19-96b6-9d8a28c59318) (ideally, we have the former but not the latter) to buy [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48). But if we are slightly behind on cash or feeling otherwise too squishy, we can buy [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643) for survivability and a nice stats boost in general. If we want to lean even harder into Dragonblade, buy [Transference Delta](item_4bcdd047-90a2-43af-8d57-160cb21022ee).

On the other hand, if we've done so well that we can not only buy a third Epic but have enough to buy a sixth item on top of it, buy [Technoleech](item_cb7fd8bf-bdcc-439a-ad35-372f24a027a8) or one of the core greens. If you have three blues and three purples by Round 5, that's a really good round.

In Round 6, we want to buy another Epic. We have a few options:
- Armor is a notable weakness of this build, and if the enemy has been building a lot of Armor, [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) is useful for mitigating it.
- Curiously, Dragonblade scales with both AD *and* AP, despite what the game says, meaning that a hybrid AP/AD build is now a reasonable option here. The goal is to end up with 30-40% AP by Round 7. [Champion's Kit](item_8682f8c7-8811-439b-8d50-fa81cd43ddce) would get us there in one fell swoop, but unless you're the server admin, you probably can't afford it.
- [Cybervenom](item_210a8582-91ec-4cf3-968a-a443f3a0c505) is a good alternative; using it will allow you to do things like apply a massive healing reduction to the entire team via Dragonblade (careful about Kiriko though). [Three-tap Tommygun](item_39c5d2a4-1db0-444f-86d9-2a1e9a331429) will increase our attack speed even further and is good against tanky/overhealth comps (Queen, Mercy, Lucio, Rein, etc.). [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e) is a good Dragonblade-friendly item of "average" cost.
- If we want more survivability, especially if we intend to lean into Dragonblade later, [Lumerico Fusion Drive](item_3da81000-333c-460a-a1a2-09441bfda9c8) is nice.
- Of course, [Transference Delta](item_4bcdd047-90a2-43af-8d57-160cb21022ee) is still an option here as well, though it might be better to buy this and [Lumerico Fusion Drive](item_3da81000-333c-460a-a1a2-09441bfda9c8) to become a tanky Dragonblade ultra beast in Round 7 if we can afford it.

By Round 7, we have many options for both Powers and Items. We'll start with Powers first:
- The most generalist option is probably [Wyrm’s Maw](item_5d8c3488-13a9-432a-987e-275522f68cc4), because our poking means that the ability will always proc.
- [Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168) is a good anti-Genji alternative, because the Dragonblade swing on Deflect end inherits all the buffs that normal Dragonblade gets from our items (be aware that many melee builds also use this ability, so the enemy Genji might fire it right back).
- [Laceration](item_ee831ad3-3921-4aca-a761-c6b93cc7e7fe) is just strong in general, works well against tankier enemies, and works well with the AP/AD hybrid build.
- Consider [Hanamura Healing](item_d210417d-1e30-4571-a4f3-cccd1dfc23ca) if you are a left-click crit demon or like to chain Swift Strike combos together.

As for Items, it's rare that you will be able to afford six Epics, so we will assume you can't. It doesn't really matter which blue you keep, although [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) is more expensive, so if your budget is a bit tight, sell it first. Here are your options:
- Sell a blue and [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e) and get [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) and [Lumerico Fusion Drive](item_3da81000-333c-460a-a1a2-09441bfda9c8). This is an excellent final-round build that makes you tanky and counter armor at the same time. If they haven't stacked a lot of armor, lean into Dragonblade with [Enduring Edge](item_6a68babb-9434-42a0-8374-5b5973e8b6db) or [Transference Delta](item_4bcdd047-90a2-43af-8d57-160cb21022ee).
- You could also get *both* of the above Dragonblade items if you're willing to lose out on [Lumerico Fusion Drive](item_3da81000-333c-460a-a1a2-09441bfda9c8). This makes you less generalist, but greatly improves your Dragonblades.
- Sell a blue to get [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643), which is just good in general.
- If you're a left-click demon, you could get [The Closer](item_173c6d0f-dbe6-440e-924f-0ce08189ddce). I would not recommend replacing [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b) with it though because you actually lose a little AD that way and the passive on Spider is more useful for you than the passive on Closer.

If you *do* have the money to buy six Epics, though, what are your options?
- The best overall six-Epic build involves replacing both blues and [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e) with [Three-tap Tommygun](item_39c5d2a4-1db0-444f-86d9-2a1e9a331429), [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643), and [Commander's Clip](item_ff7cad01-2065-4908-a2c1-3bdf1458c7a4). This is a hybrid AD/AP poke build with insane stats, including an *absurd* 40% attack speed (and that's *base* without proccing Powers or Items). This can go up to ***80%* (!!) attack speed**!
- Sell both blues and Iris to get the three best Dragonblade Epics ([Enduring Edge](item_6a68babb-9434-42a0-8374-5b5973e8b6db), [Transference Delta](item_4bcdd047-90a2-43af-8d57-160cb21022ee), and [Lumerico Fusion Drive](item_3da81000-333c-460a-a1a2-09441bfda9c8)) to become an unstoppable Dragonblade machine. The attack speed is not as high as in the previous six-Epic build, but you basically won't die if you press Q.
- Optionally, replace [Enduring Edge](item_6a68babb-9434-42a0-8374-5b5973e8b6db) with [Champion's Kit](item_8682f8c7-8811-439b-8d50-fa81cd43ddce) (if you're rich as heck) to basically 1v6 people with Dragonblade with all the damage and attack speed you have. Since Dragonblade also scales with AD, you can even use an AD-equivalent boost item here to go even crazier with shuriken damage as well.

There's no one best loadout here, though the non-optional items here provide the best "balance", in my opinion. You're decently tanky, you have a good balance between all your stats, and you're highly survivable during Dragonblade, which will do 50% more damage and have 30-55% more attack speed. You can optimize for better AD, AP, survivability, or overall Dragonblade power, but not without sacrificing something else. If you know what "Pareto optimality" is, this build feels like it has that.

Also, any instance of [Commander's Clip](item_ff7cad01-2065-4908-a2c1-3bdf1458c7a4) can be replaced with [Swift-Loader](item_eea704c1-7326-4298-9aa0-0f6491515f55), a similar item of equivalent price that rewards Swift Strike combos as well. [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e) and [Cybervenom](item_210a8582-91ec-4cf3-968a-a443f3a0c505) also go well with the Dragonblade items, but they're a bit more expensive, so I didn't include them because you likely won't be able to budget for them.
